form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Rockefeller (for himself and Mr. Thune) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
Reported by Mr. Rockefeller, without amendment

form.official-title: To amend the law relating to sport fish restoration and recreational boating safety, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sport Fish Restoration and Recreational Boating Safety Act of 2014.
Section 4 of the Federal Aid in Fish Restoration Act (16 U.S.C. 777c) is amended—

paragraph.text: by amending the heading in subsection (b) to read as follows: Set-asides.—;

clause.text: in clause (i), by striking each of fiscal years 2001 and 2002, $9,000,000 and inserting fiscal year 2015, $11,896,000;
in clause (ii), by striking 2003, $8,212,000 and inserting 2016, $12,299,000; and

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: From the annual appropriation made in accordance with section 3, for each fiscal year through 2021, the Secretary shall transfer to the Secretary of the department in which the Coast Guard is operating—

subclause.text: $5,000,000 for the purposes set forth in section 13107(c) of title 46, United States Code;
$200,000 to fund the National Boating Safety Advisory Council established under section 13110 of title 46, United States Code, and the authorized activities of the Council; and

not less than $7,000,000 for national boating safety activities of national nonprofit public service organizations, and such sums made available for allocation and distribution shall remain available until expended.

clause.text: The amounts specified in clause (i) for a fiscal year may not be included in the amount of the annual appropriation distributed under subsection (a) of this section for the fiscal year.

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking under paragraph (1) shall remain available for obligation for use under that paragraph and inserting under paragraph (1)(B) shall remain available for obligation for use under paragraph (1)(A); and

clause.text: by striking under paragraph (1) and inserting under paragraph (1)(B); and
by striking subsection (e) and inserting subsection (c);

paragraph.text: in subsection (d), by striking So much of any sum not allocated and inserting Except as otherwise provided in this section, so much of any sum not allocated; and

subparagraph.text: by amending paragraph (2) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: For fiscal year 2015, the Secretary of the Interior may use not more than $1,200,000 in accordance with paragraph (1). For each fiscal year thereafter, the maximum amount that the Secretary of the Interior may use in accordance with paragraph (1) shall be determined under paragraph (3).

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The maximum amount referred to in paragraph (2) for fiscal year 2016 and each fiscal year thereafter shall be the sum of—

subparagraph.text: the available maximum amount for the preceding fiscal year; and

clause.text: the available maximum amount for the preceding fiscal year; and
the change, relative to the preceding fiscal year, in the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers published by the Department of Labor.

section.header: Extension of exception to limitation on transfers to fund
section.text: Section 9504(d)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking 2014, and inserting 2021,.
Section 13104 of title 46, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (c).
Section 13107(c) of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking subsection (a)(2) and inserting subsection (b)(1)(C); and
by striking (16 U.S.C. 777c(a)(2)) and all that follows through the end and inserting

$5,000,000 is available to the Secretary for payment of expenses of the Coast Guard for personnel and activities directly related to coordinating and carrying out the national recreational boating safety program under this title, of which not less than $2,000,000 shall be available to the Secretary only to ensure compliance with chapter 43 of this title;
$200,000 is available to the Secretary to fund the National Boating Safety Advisory Council and its authorized activities; and
not less than $7,000,000 is available to the Secretary for national boating safety activities of national nonprofit public service organizations.

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), by striking Amounts made available and inserting Except for amounts made available by paragraph (1)(C), amounts made available.

section.text: Section 13110(e) of title 46, United States Code, is amended by striking 2020 and inserting 2021.
